result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Christopher Stuczynski

records.addlTxt: Court is down on 12-16-2022.  Court rescheduled plea/sentencing hearing.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2023 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Robert Christopher Stuczynski not in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared for Robert Christopher Stuczynski.  Attorney Grace M. Gall appeared for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Robert Christopher Stuczynski not in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Robert Christopher Stuczynski.  Attorney Grace M. Gall appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert Christopher Stuczynski in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Robert Christopher Stuczynski in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, appear by video. Defendant Robert Christopher Stuczynski not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Attorney Thomas Harris
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:
Dunkin' at 3659 S 27th St

SAH (02/03/1999)
LDM (10/26/1985)
MMT (05/14/2007)
OLT (03/19/2005)
NMW (09/15/1984)
TLN (06/18/1998)

Defendant Robert Christopher Stuczynski in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Robert Christopher Stuczynski in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert Christopher Stuczynski appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
